intro: Big news this week: Fractal Analytics’ muted IPO debut signals persistent AI fears in India, and what it means for your roadmap.

briefing.title: GT-HarmBench: Benchmarking AI Safety Risks Through the Lens of Game Theory
briefing.note: New performance numbers for HarmBench could change cost-quality tradeoffs if they replicate. Why it matters: If HarmBench numbers replicate on real workloads, current model or tool selections may need revisiting.

briefing.title: ClawRouter
briefing.note: Growing traction for ClawRouter on GitHub suggests rising builder interest. Why it matters: Community interest in ClawRouter is growing — check repo health before committing.

editors_note.headline: This week
editors_note.thesis: This week's signal is clear: business model decisions are moving faster than product roadmaps. If you're not tracking Fractal Analytics’ muted IPO debut signals persistent AI fears in India, you're already behind.
editors_note.hook: The headline drives the week, but the real question is what it means for your vendor assumptions and Q2 plans.
editors_note.spotlight: The lead story is the most likely to change near-term decisions for teams shipping AI products.
editors_note.underhyped: GT-HarmBench: Benchmarking AI Safety Risks Through the Lens of Game Theory deserves more attention than it's getting.
editors_note.risk: Vendor and pricing risk is elevated this week — review your dependency list.

lead_story.title: Fractal Analytics’ muted IPO debut signals persistent AI fears in India
lead_story.what_happened: The Fractal Analytics development has implications for vendor strategy and competitive positioning.
lead_story.our_take: Strategic positioning around Fractal Analytics is shifting faster than most roadmap cycles account for.
lead_story.what_to_do: Add Fractal Analytics as a discussion item in your next strategy or planning meeting.

articles.title: ClawRouter
articles.summary: ClawRouter is a development worth monitoring for near-term product and tooling decisions (via GitHub Trending (AI/ML)).
articles.what_happened: Growing traction for ClawRouter on GitHub suggests rising builder interest.
articles.why_it_matters: Community interest in ClawRouter is growing — check repo health before committing.
articles.what_to_do: Check ClawRouter for recent activity, open issues, and license compatibility this week.
articles.our_take: Popularity and production-readiness are different things. Check the last commit date and open issues first.

articles.title: GT-HarmBench: Benchmarking AI Safety Risks Through the Lens of Game Theory
articles.authors: Pepijn Cobben, Xuanqiang Angelo Huang, Thao Amelia Pham et al.
articles.summary: New performance numbers for HarmBench need independent validation before changing production decisions (via arXiv CS.AI).
articles.what_happened: New performance numbers for HarmBench could change cost-quality tradeoffs if they replicate.
articles.why_it_matters: If HarmBench numbers replicate on real workloads, current model or tool selections may need revisiting.
articles.what_to_do: Compare the HarmBench eval setup to yours — check if the benchmark conditions match your workload.
articles.our_take: Benchmark wins look impressive on paper, but production workloads rarely match evaluation conditions.

prompt_of_the_week.text: Rewrite this API documentation to be developer-friendly. Keep it accurate but make it scannable with clear examples.
